Tensor Objects¶

Bottle implements an N-Dimensional container called a Tensor. This container owns a single contiguous block of memory, and accessed elements based on its shape and strides attributes. These tensors can be sliced and indexed to create “views” of tensors that do not own their own data. These “views” track where they get their data from through their base attribute.

  • The N-dimensional tensor
    • Constructing Tensors
    • Indexing arrays
    • Internal memory layout of an Tensor
